attributes.action: Recognise that the British public believe the Respect given to the armed forces to be inadequate
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Armed Forces of this country should be treated with respect. The refusal to serve Soldiers in Uniform in places such as petrol stations, public houses, clubs and the like is totally unacceptable and should stop forthwith.
Our Serving men and women wear that Uniform with pride, and sacrifice much in the Service of their country - the least they deserve in return is to be treated with dignity and respect, and be allowed to go about their business in the same way as everyone else. Nobody has the right to stop them from entering a shop or public house because they are in uniform. That would not happen to a member of the Police Force or other uniformed organisations - and rightly so - therefore, it should not be allowed to happen to a Soldier.
This country of ours should back our Troops and give them the respect and support they rightly deserve.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
